Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed. We are a fast-growing global company with 80 quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of over 10,000 companies, including 2,000+ networks and 3,000 cloud and IT service providers in over 30 countries spanning six continents – and counting! A leadership role at Equinix means you will drive and collaborate on work that impacts the world. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. Job Summary The Office of the CTO at Equinix is looking for a “Distinguished Engineer, Physical Infrastructure” who will join a team of seasoned technologists chartered with: Driving next-generation technology development & innovation to guide decisions on new investments and service offerings; Developing the company’s technology roadmap and target architecture to advance the vision of Platform Equinix based on a “software-defined-everything” model; and Delivering industry thought leadership, with a focus on building a closer engagement with the software developer community We are looking for seasoned technologists who bring a deep passion for innovation in physical infrastructure (physical data center, power, rack-level infrastructure, etc.) and new perspectives from diverse technology backgrounds and areas, including, and not limited to, software-defined data center, open hardware, distributed systems, cloud-native computing, artificial intelligence, etc. The “Distinguished Engineer, Physical Infrastructure” role reports directly to the Chief Technology Officer at Equinix. While the preferred location for the role is our global headquarters in Redwood City, CA (or Sunnyvale, CA), there is an option for the selected candidate to be based at other major Equinix locations. As a Distinguished Engineer, you will have the opportunity to drive new next-generation technology initiatives; help drive the technology vision and target architecture of Platform Equinix; significantly contribute to improving Equinix’s technology stack; and serve as a mentor and thought leader to the technical community at Equinix. This is a highly-senior role and an outstanding opportunity for a passionate technical leader to join our team and make a significant and sustainable impact to our technology stack. If you fully believe in the power of technology to change the world, we would like to talk to you. Responsibilities Provide in-depth technical expertise to identify and evaluate next-generation technologies and assess their impact to the physical infrastructure of future at Equinix (spanning datacenter and hardware domains) Drive proof-of-concept technology development initiatives, in close partnership with stakeholders, to deliver tangible outcomes that will help guide new technology investments and design decisions for physical infrastructure Provide senior thought leadership to deliver architecture recommendations for the evolution of physical infrastructure at Equinix with a focus on a software-defined-everything vision and based on emerging technologies and trends, including, and not limited to, high power density, next-generation cooling and energy management, sustainability, silicon roadmap, physical/hardware-based security, cloud-native deployments, quantum computing, etc Serve as a visible technology thought leader in the industry through various engagements focused on articulating the technology vision and unique value proposition of Platform Equinix, including in interactions with customers, partners, forums, analysts and investment community Qualifications Preferably, a Ph.D. or Master’s degree in computer science, or relevant engineering field 20+ years of experience, including 12+ years of relevant infrastructure technology, architecture or engineering leadership experience Demonstrable leadership, visionary accomplishments, and extensive experience in developing physical infrastructure technologies and architectures implemented in large-scale/mission-critical deployments. Examples include solid background in physical infrastructure architecture, engineering, DevOps, security, tooling, products, etc Solid understanding of software-defined physical infrastructure architectures (digital twins, software-defined energy management, etc.), open hardware, physical infrastructure observability, sustainability and security Excellent writing and verbal communications skills from engineering to executive Excellent collaboration and people skills The targeted pay range for this position in the following location is / locations are: San Francisco, CA / Bay Area: $209,000 to $375,000 Our pay ranges reflect the minimum and maximum target for new hire pay for the full-time position determined by role, level, and location.
